The phytic acid content of the sample was determined by the procedure described by Aina et al. (2012) [ 25]. To a 250 mL Erlenmeyer flask, 100 mL of 2% HCl was used to macerate 2.0 g pulverized plant sample for 3 h and then filtered. A volume of 25 mL of the filtrate was pipetted into 5 mL 0.3% ammonium thiocyanate solution in a conical flask. The solution was titrated against standard FeCl 3 solution (0.001 95 g of Fe/mL) until an endpoint brownish-yellow colour persisted for a few minutes.
